unnormalised: ## Chasing Clouds: My Misadventures with Indian Airlines (and Chai!)
normalised: ## Chasing Clouds: My Misadventures with Indian Airlines (and Chai!)

unnormalised: Okay, so, full disclosure, I’m not exactly a seasoned travel blogger. More like a perpetually-delayed-at-the-airport-blogger. But hey, who needs perfect itineraries when you have a good story (and maybe a strategically placed power bank)? This time, it’s all about my recent escapades trying to navigate the wonderful, sometimes chaotic, world of Indian Airways.
normalised: Okay, so, full disclosure, I’m not exactly a seasoned travel blogger. More like a perpetually-delayed-at-the-airport-blogger. But hey, who needs perfect itineraries when you have a good story (and maybe a strategically placed power bank)? This time, it’s all about my recent escapades trying to navigate the wonderful, sometimes chaotic, world of Indian Airways.

unnormalised: My first flight was with Indigo, from Delhi to Guwahati. The website promised a smooth 2 hr flight. I was already dreaming of momos and Assam tea. Check-in was surprisingly painless, but then came the inevitable “gate change.” Gate 42B? No, wait, now it’s 48C! Classic. Eventually, we boarded at 14:30 IST, a whole 45 mins after the scheduled departure. But hey, who’s counting? (Me, apparently.)
normalised: My first flight was with Indigo, from Delhi to Guwahati. The website promised a smooth two hour flight. I was already dreaming of momos and Assam tea. Check-in was surprisingly painless, but then came the inevitable “gate change.” Gate forty two B? No, wait, now it’s forty eight C! Classic. Eventually, we boarded at fourteen thirty I-S-T, a whole forty five minutes after the scheduled departure. But hey, who’s counting? (Me, apparently.)

unnormalised: Then there was the Air India flight from Mumbai to Kochi. Booked it months in advance, thinking I was all organised. Got to the airport, only to find out it was delayed by 3 hrs due to "operational reasons." The announcement crackled over the loudspeaker, leaving everyone looking utterly bewildered. Luckily, the airport chai stall was open. Cost me Rs. 20, but it was a life saver.
normalised: Then there was the Air India flight from Mumbai to Kochi. Booked it months in advance, thinking I was all organised. Luckily, the airport chai stall was open. Cost me rupee twenty, but it was a life saver.

unnormalised: The best (or should I say, most interesting?) part was trying to understand the baggage allowance. Apparently, 15 kg is the magic number for check-in baggage, and anything over that incurs a hefty fine. I swear my suitcase wasn't *that* heavy. Turns out, my mom had secretly packed extra ladoos for the trip. Bless her heart.

unnormalised: My SpiceJet flight from Bangalore to Jaipur was relatively uneventful, thank goodness. Although, the in-flight magazine had an article claiming Jaipur was only 250 km from Bangalore. I’m pretty sure someone needs to check their Google Maps. I think it's more like 2000+ km!
normalised: My SpiceJet flight from Bangalore to Jaipur was relatively uneventful, thank goodness. Although, the in-flight magazine had an article claiming Jaipur was only two hundred and fifty kilometer from Bangalore. I’m pretty sure someone needs to check their Google Maps. I think it's more like two thousand plus kilometer!

unnormalised: But the real highlight was a tiny little regional carrier called TruJet, flying from Hyderabad to Tirupati. The plane felt like a vintage car, and the legroom was…minimal. The flight attendants were incredibly sweet, though, offering everyone a complimentary packet of Parle-G biscuits. Talk about a blast from the past!

unnormalised: One thing I have learned is to always double-check my PNR number (just in case), and to always, always factor in at least an extra hour for delays. And download movies to my phone, because airport wifi is a myth.
normalised: One thing I have learned is to always double-check my P-N-R number (just in case), and to always, always factor in at least an extra hour for delays. And download movies to my phone, because airport wifi is a myth.

unnormalised: Despite all the delays, gate changes, and questionable geographical claims, I wouldn't trade my Indian Airways adventures for anything. It's a reminder that travel is not just about the destination, but about the unexpected detours, the friendly faces, and the perfectly brewed cup of chai. Just remember to check your flight status (SG 234 or AI 501 or whatever it is) and keep a positive attitude. And maybe pack your own snacks.
